article.headline: Belmont 74, Mercer 73
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Brian Collins scored 17 points and the go-ahead basket as Belmont beat Mercer 74-73 in the Atlantic Sun Conference matchup Saturday. Collins was fouled shooting a 3-pointer with three seconds to play and hit one-of-two from the line to put the Bruins (4-8, 3-1) ahead at the buzzer. A Collins tip-in put Belmont up 69-67 with 2:22 on the clock, and Snyder followed with a layup at 1:41 to go up 71-67. Mercer (7-4, 3-2) responded with a set of three free-throws pull to 71-70 with 1:23 left, but a layup by Collins with 53 seconds put the Bruins ahead 73-71. Jacob Skogan hit a 3-pointer for Mercer with 34 seconds, but Collins sealed the game for Belmont at the foul line. Mercer's top scorer, James Odom with 25, went cold in the second half with no baskets and only one attempt after the 11:57 mark. Wesley Duke scored 16 and Will Emerson 12 for the Bears. Justin Hare had 15 points for Belmont. Andrew Preston added 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
